title: Understanding the Task
text: To copy a range of cells to a nonadjacent destination, you need to understand how to select and paste data in Excel.

title: Selecting the Range
text: First, select the range of cells you want to copy. You can do this by clicking and dragging your mouse over the cells.

title: Copying the Range
text: After selecting the range, use the 'Copy' function. You can do this by right-clicking and selecting 'Copy' or by pressing $$Ctrl+C$$ on your keyboard.

title: Pasting to a Nonadjacent Area
text: Navigate to the destination area where you want to paste the copied range. Click on the first cell of the destination area.

hintAnswer: select the cell, then type $$"What-If$$ Assumptions" as a new row titles and click enter. Select the range and then $$copy-paste$$ it into the original cell
title: Final Step: Pasting
text: Use the 'Paste' function to paste the copied range into the destination area. You can do this by right-clicking and selecting 'Paste' or by pressing $$Ctrl+V$$ on your keyboard.
choices: select the cell, then type $$"What-If$$ Assumptions" as a new row titles and click enter. Select the range and then $$copy-paste$$ it into the original cell
select the range and click on the $$what-if$$ button under the home tab
